At the end of the day, you're complaining about GAREN.

After 10 years this hapless champion finally performs one niche pick decently; let it go.

Maybe if riot allowed stuff other than marksman+support to be viable bot, then Garen+Yuumi wouldn't be that much of a problem.

Now if a duo bot counters specifically a Marksman+Support pairing it's deemed "OP" and get's the nerf bat instantly.

If it was a more diverse bot meta like IDK Double assassins or double bruisers or Bruiser+MAge then Garen Yuumi would face a much harder time both farming and killing.

It is indeed a vicious circle.

Now, I really love spicy picks so I might be biased, but I really dislike how Marksmen have such a tight grip on the bot role in every meta. Like, in every other lane, multiple champion classes are always equally strong/popular. I don't see why such a specific class gets to be so dominant in EVERY META for 10 years now.

beta into season 1 was alot of weird random stuff. 

adcs solo mid , bruiser/support bot  APC top,  support junglers 

they didnt have a set meta it was kinda random as the high elo/pros figured out the best way to split and use resources on the map hence the meta we have with solo top, jng , solo mid , duo bot. 

this came about due to the champ types , power curves/spikes etc 

such as mid lane is the quickest lane to get to from base, you can get to both side lanes, so alot of roamers champs that could push waves and typically mid lane lvls the fastest so champs who hit earlier power spikes could take advantage of other lanes such as ap carries typically rushed into heavy ap by lvl 6 while most enemies on map put little to no gold into getting mr. or assassins hitting lvl 6 earlier then rest of map and roaming to take advantage of power spike to push lead and get fed. 

bot lane was adcs cuz they typically need 2-3 items to come on line /mid game power spikes into late game ( hyper carries ) and a support to funnel them all the gold and resources to allow them to get their items to hit power spikes. 

and then top lane became what champ could effectively stomp lane or sustain 1 vs 2 when there was the bot lane swap meta. 
in pro play bot lane would swap to push turret fast. so the top laner had to be able to scale with limited gold/items and be effective in sustaining that situation. part of why renekton was such a popular pick in pro play for a while in previous seasons. 

and typically your jungle or top laner pick would be used to round out a team comp ( pro play) for either the tank/engage or whatever was needed after the mid/adc was priority 

slowly the game as adapted from this and we see more lane /match up diversity but every time this happens the player base who dont know how to adapt and adjust cry over it, such as the rant in this post
